sentences.sContent: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
sentences.sCn: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信，我看上去棒极了！

sentences.sContent: Despite the fact that I have tried to be objective, the book inevitably mirrors my own interests and experiences.
sentences.sCn: 尽管我曾努力做到客观，但这本书还是不可避免地反映出了我自己的兴趣和经历。

phrases.pCn: 抛物柱面镜；抛物面反射镜

remMethod.val: mir(惊奇) + ror → 惊奇地在镜子中看见自己 → 镜子

words.tran: 反映（mirror的过去式和过去分词）；反射

trans.tranOther: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in

trans.tranCn: 反映； 反射， 映照
trans.tranOther: If something mirrors something else, it has similar features to it, and therefore seems like a copy or representation of it
